question_text: Select two key characteristics of a private address configuration in virtual networking.
answer_options: Restricts VM from communicating with external networks
Uses NAT to bridge into the LAN
Supports communication only with selected internal devices
Automatically receives a public IP from the router
correct_answer: Restricts VM from communicating with external networks
Supports communication only with selected internal devices
explanation: Private network modes isolate the VM, allowing only tightly scoped or internal communications.
